title: Scientific Research Methodology Through the Design Research Paradigm Cycle

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific research methodologies and research design concepts
context.additional_context: Emphasis on Self-Directed Research Activities and Small-Group Collaborative Learning Using Personal Devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain research paradigms (positivism, interpretivism, critical theory, constructivism) and analyze their relevance to design research.
Learners can write and present a research plan applying the four stages of design research (problem definition, solution design, implementation, evaluation).
Learners can suggest revised research designs incorporating peer feedback through formative assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
